results.title: A Writer-Director-Star Breaks Through. It Only Took a Lifetime.
results.abstract: Radha Blank spent years trying to impress the theater world. Now, her Sundance hit, “The Forty-Year-Old Version,” is proof that dreams don’t expire.

multimedia.caption: Blank says of the movie: “The thing that makes it maybe groundbreaking is that someone who looks like me is at the center and behind the camera.”

results.abstract: Frederick Wiseman captures life unfolding within institutions. If that sounds boring, the riveting “Public Housing” shows why his work is anything but.

results.title: Margaret Nolan, ‘Goldfinger’ Actress, Dies at 76
results.abstract: She drew fame at age 20, painted in gold, in the Bond film’s opening credits, then went on to appear in “A Hard Day’s Night,” with the Beatles, and other productions, before turning to art and politics.

multimedia.caption: Margaret Nolan in 1965. The British actress was featured in the opening title sequence of the James Bond film “Goldfinger” and in the movie as a masseuse named Dink.

results.abstract: James’s 1898 novella “The Turn of the Screw” has been adapted in many forms, the latest being a new Netflix series. Here’s a look at the story’s history onscreen.
results.title: ‘The Haunting of Bly Manor’ Brings Back the Ghosts of Henry James

results.abstract: Cineworld, the parent company of the second largest chain in the U.S., is closing all its theaters in the country, as studios keep postponing releases and audiences remain reluctant to return to the movies.
results.title: With No New Films, Regal Cinemas Shuts Down Again
‘The Social Network’ 10 Years Later: A Grim Online Life Foretold
results.abstract: At the time, the fictional story of Facebook’s founding seemed overdramatic; now it underscores how our connections have changed, especially in the Covid era.
